revised_title: Spinal Curvature in Aboriginal Australians and Its Comparison with Europeans and Chimpanzees
tldr: This study examines the spinal curvature in an aboriginal Australian and compares it with Europeans and Chimpanzees. The research finds that the Australian spine has a more pronounced lumbar curve, similar to the curve in European females. The lumbar curve in Australians is due to the wedge-shaped form of intervertebral disks, while Europeans have a more uniform curve. The study also highlights the differences in the axial curve composition and the importance of cartilage in the lumbar region of the vertebral column.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Anatomy
